entry.title: Gemini 3 Flash: Creative UI in a spark

media:group.media:title: Gemini 3 Flash: Creative UI in a spark
media:group.media:description:
Gemini 3 Flash excels in capabilities required for rapid prototyping, including instant code generation, aesthetic versatility, and creative ideation. It can also natively drive the design process, like generating new prompts for style exploration, and can produce multiple distinct UI variations with just a single click to accelerate development.
Learn more at https://deepmind.google/models/gemini/flash/ ___

media:group.media:title: Gemini 3 Flash: Transform messy data
media:group.media:description:
Gemini 3 Flash is a great tool for a tedious, multi-step processes (Example: "Extract, transform, load‚Äù) for merging two messy data sources. It‚Äôs a common problem in enterprise settings, where developers often have to parse unstructured data into databases. Gemini 3 Flash solves for this with its multimodal and complex reasoning capabilities.
Learn more at https://deepmind.google/models/gemini/flash/ ___

media:group.media:title: Gemini 3 Flash: Evolve code faster
media:group.media:description:
Gemini 3 Flash enables modern coding workflows, including ultra-low latency, near real-time code generation, and rapid iteration. It can also natively facilitate A/B testing, like evolving the perfect loading spinner in milliseconds, and can adapt to user selections to generate refined code variants in real time.
Learn more at https://deepmind.google/models/gemini/flash/ ___

entry.title: Gemini 3 Flash: Renders faster and efficiently

media:group.media:title: Gemini 3 Flash: Renders faster and efficiently
media:group.media:description:
Gemini 3 Flash excels in speed and efficiency by coding SVG images, HTML, and three.js side-by-side between 3 Flash and 2.5 Pro. 3 Flash generates the imagery better, faster and with fewer token usage.
Learn more at https://deepmind.google/models/gemini/flash/ ___

entry.title: Gemini 3 Flash: Assist in real-time game play

media:group.media:title: Gemini 3 Flash: Assist in real-time game play
media:group.media:description:
Gemini 3 Flash specializes in capabilities critical for live assistance, including complex geometric calculation, velocity estimation, and multimodal processing. It can also simultaneously analyze video and hand-tracking inputs to provide strategic, real-time guidance in this slingshot game.
Learn more at https://deepmind.google/models/gemini/flash/ ___

entry.title: Gemini 3 Flash: Orchestrate a function call kitchen

media:group.media:title: Gemini 3 Flash: Orchestrate a function call kitchen
media:group.media:description:
Gemini 3 Flash specializes in capabilities critical for large-scale agentic workflows, including reliable function calling at scale, resource reasoning, and low-latency execution. It can natively reason across vast inventories‚Äîselecting and combining over 100 tools and 100 ingredients‚Äîand leverages world knowledge of international recipes to output a single comprehensive, delicious recipe
Learn more at https://deepmind.google/models/gemini/flash/ Try in AI Studio: https://aistudio.google.com/apps/bundled/function_call_kitchen ___

entry.title: Gemini 3 Flash: Generate a narrative of your journey

media:group.media:title: Gemini 3 Flash: Generate a narrative of your journey
media:group.media:description:
This model specializes in capabilities critical for context-aware storytelling, including rapid planning, map data analysis, and creative text generation. It can also natively interpret route logistics, like translating journey duration into narrative pacing, and can adapt to diverse writing styles to weave a personalized story in real time.
Learn more at https://deepmind.google/models/gemini/flash/ ___

entry.title: Gemini 3 Flash: Visual context in an instant

media:group.media:title: Gemini 3 Flash: Visual context in an instant
media:group.media:description:
Gemini 3 Flash adds a contextual UI on image generations, showing its strong multimodal capabilities in understanding visual input and reasoning to describe the content of the image in a compelling and interactive way.

entry.title: The future of intelligence | Demis Hassabis (Co-founder and CEO of DeepMind)

media:group.media:title: The future of intelligence | Demis Hassabis (Co-founder and CEO of DeepMind)
media:group.media:description:
In our final episode of the season, Professor Hannah Fry sits down with Google DeepMind Co-founder and CEO Demis Hassabis for their annual check-in. Together, they look beyond the product launches to the scientific and technological questions that will define the next decade.
Demis shares his vision for the path to AGI - from solving "root node" problems in fusion energy and material science to the rise of world models and simulations. They also explore what's beyond the frontier and the importance of balancing scientific rigor amid the competitive dynamics of AI advancement.
Thanks for joining us this year! üîî Subscribe to stay updated on our return in 2026, and revisit our episode library to catch up on everything from driverless cars to drug discovery: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLqYmG7hTraZBiUr6_Qf8YTS2Oqy3OGZEj
Timecodes 01:42 2025 progress 05:14 Jagged intelligence 07:32 Mathematical version of AlphaGo? 09:30 Science vs commercialization 12:42 Scaling 17:43 Genie and simulation 25:47 Evolution in simulation 28:26 AI bubble 31:56 Building ethical AI 34:31 AGI 44:44 Turing machines 49:06 How it feels to lead
___

entry.title: The arrival of AGI | Shane Legg (co-founder of DeepMind)

media:group.media:title: The arrival of AGI | Shane Legg (co-founder of DeepMind)
media:group.media:description:
Shane Legg, Chief AGI Scientist and co-founder of Google DeepMind, has been talking about artificial general intelligence, or AGI, for more than a decade. So what‚Äôs changed? According to Shane, now is the time to take it seriously.
In this episode, Shane walks host Hannah Fry through his AGI framework, breaking down the levels from minimal AGI to full AGI, and his timelines for each. They discuss the economic and societal shifts AGI will bring, the potential impact on work, and the extraordinary possibilities for human flourishing.
Timecodes 00:00 Coming up 00:41 Intro 13:43 Defining artificial general intelligence 26:20 Ethics of AGI 40:10 Societal and economic transformation 45:10 Future of work 50:00 Potential for human flourishing
Further reading
Levels of AGI paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.02462 The road to AGI (Google DeepMind Podcast, S2): https://youtu.be/Uy4OYU7PQYA
___

entry.title: Google DeepMind robotics lab tour with Hannah Fry

media:group.media:title: Google DeepMind robotics lab tour with Hannah Fry
media:group.media:description:
In this episode, we open the archives on host Hannah Fry‚Äôs visit to our California robotics lab. Filmed earlier this year, Hannah interacts with a new set of robots‚Äîthose that don't just see, but think, plan, and do. Watch as the team goes behind the scenes to test the limits of generalization, challenging robots to handle unseen objects autonomously.
Learn more about our most recent models: https://deepmind.google/models/gemini-robotics/
____
Presenter: Professor Hannah Fry Video editor: Anthony Le Audio engineer: Perry Rogantin Visual identity: Rob Ashley Commissioned by Google DeepMind Series Producer: Dan Hardoon Editor: Rami Tzabar Commissioner & Producer: Emma Yousif Music composition: Eleni Shaw

entry.title: What does ancient bridge building and AI have in common?

media:group.media:title: What does ancient bridge building and AI have in common?
media:group.media:description:
Distinguished Scientist John Jumper explains how confidence in AI tools for science can come from seeing them perform reliably ‚Äì similar to ancient builders constructing safe bridges without knowing the equations of their engineering.
He shares his journey from helping develop AlphaFold and being awarded a Nobel Prize, to accelerating science with AI ‚Äì all on our podcast with @fryrsquared

media:group.media:title: What‚Äôs new in Gemini 3?
media:group.media:description:
ICYMI: Gemini 3 is out now. Here‚Äôs what you need to know.
üß† State-of-the-art reasoning and multimodal capabilities üçå Nano Banana Pro for image generation and editing üíª Google Antigravity for agentic coding
Learn more at https://deepmind.google

entry.title: AlphaFold: Grand challenge to Nobel Prize | John Jumper

media:group.media:title: AlphaFold: Grand challenge to Nobel Prize | John Jumper
media:group.media:description:
Five years ago, AlphaFold 2 solved the protein structure prediction problem, unlocking new avenues of biological research and providing our first major proof point that AI can be a powerful tool to advance science and cure disease. The profound scientific and societal value of this work was even recognized in 2024 with the Nobel Prize in Chemistry. In this episode, Hannah is joined by John Jumper, one of the most instrumental scientists behind AlphaFold. He shares stories about his Nobel win, the tool's unexpected applications, and the shift in architecture from AlphaFold 2 to the more comprehensive AlphaFold 3.
Learn more about AlphaFold: https://deepmind.google/science/alphafold/
Watch the story behind AlphaFold on the Thinking Game, now available for free: https://youtu.be/d95J8yzvjbQ
___
Timecodes 00:00 Intro 02:06 The Nobel Prize call 06:35 The "Grand Challenge" breakthrough 09:42 Reactions from the community 12:48 Unexpected use cases 16:04 AlphaFold 3 and diffusion models 26:54 Roman aqueducts 33:46 Designing new proteins 40:40 Does AI think? 46:51 Hannah's reflections ___
